snippet: The latest such attack, on Monday, struck the Syrian Central Bank, killing at least 15 people and wounding at least 53.
abstract: Car bomb explodes in Damascus, Syria, killing at least 15 people and injuring more than 50 others; proliferation of such attacks across country has frightened and enraged many on both sides of civil war.

byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; Hwaida Saad from Damascus; and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: The latest such attack, on Monday, struck the Syrian Central Bank, killing at least 15 people and wounding at least 53.

headline.seo: Wider Use of Car Bombs Angers Both Sides in Syria
headline.main: Wider Use of Car Bombs Angers Both Sides in Syrian Conflict
headline.print_headline: Wider Use of Car Bombs Angers Both Sides in Syrian Conflict
